data.text: A Prayer of Jesus the son of Sirach.
For thou art my defender and helper,
And hast delivered me, according to the multitude of thy mercies and greatness of thy name,
From the choking of fire on every side,
From the depth of the belly of hell,
By an accusation to the king from an unrighteous tongue
They compassed me on every side,
Then thought I upon thy mercy, O Lord,
Then lifted I up my supplication from the earth,
I called upon the Lord, the Father of my Lord,
I will praise thy name continually,
For thou savedst me from destruction,
When I was yet young, or ever I went abroad,
I prayed for her before the temple,
Even from the flower till the grape was ripe
I bowed down mine ear a little, and received her,
I profited therein,
For I purposed to do after her,
My soul hath wrestled with her,
I directed my soul unto her,
My heart was troubled in seeking her:
The Lord hath given me a tongue for my reward,
Draw near unto me, you unlearned,
Wherefore are you slow, and what say you of these things,
I opened my mouth, and said,
Put your neck under the yoke,
Behold with your eyes, how that I have had but little labour,
Get learning with a great sum of money,
Let your soul rejoice in his mercy,
Work your work betimes,
